decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Keep
Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Send

description: A strange place filled with gravestones inscribed in an ancient, long forgotten language.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Keep
Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Send

description: A strange monument of cyclopean proportions. Heavy storm clouds seem to be gathering around the settlement.
An ominous shrine from a long forgotten era. It's dangerous, but it might hold some ancient knowledge useful to the crown.
Who would worship the sun in a world with so little sunlight?

displayName: Ghost of a Blight Fighter Captain
description: I let us down and was defeated by the Blightrot... but you can avenge me! Kill it with fire!!!
I was leading a rebellion against the Queen's tyrannical rule, but the Royal Guard found us. Carry on my legacy!
Humans deserve to be treated better than the others! Without us, youd never achieve anything. If you dont meet our basic needs, well take our revenge!
I challenge you, viceroy! Do you consider yourself worthy of the Queen's glance? Prove it. Time is ticking.
I'm so sick of these Beavers! Theyre the bane of this kingdom! They deserve nothing but condemnation for what they did to us. I order you to torment them - or I'll do it myself!
They took our homes and our crops. They desecrated our culture, and in the end, they took our lives. The time of contempt has come.
These fanatics should pay for their heresies! They are dangerous, wild, and unpredictable creatures. Teach these savages, once and for all.
We will no longer tolerate those upturned beaks roaming the settlement freely. Everyone must learn the truth about how the Harpy alchemists poisoned us to seize power!
I have studied the Blightrot all my life. Nobody believes me, but the cysts are essential for the ecosystem! Grow them and find out yourself!
Self-righteous Beavers only want to bask in the luxuries weve worked so hard for. Time to end this injustice!
Greedy Human farmers always want to keep all the crops for themselves. Those traitors hid everything from us, and pretended the crops were rotten!
We worked so hard, and put our lives in danger every day. If you don't let your villagers rest, I will make sure your soul never finds peace.
It was them! I'm sure of it! I remember their blank, blight-tainted gaze! They ambushed me in the forest! Please, avenge me!
How could I have gotten lost!? Something's not right here... You! You have to help me!

orderModel: [R] Ghost Trade Routes with Value Many
description: Hey, you! You're a viceroy, ain't you? Your bastard friends attacked me and left me to die in the woods! Prove to me you're not like them!
You hear it? This ominous forest is calling to us... Withstand its fury, and I will spare your settlement.
Madness, they said, but genius knows no bounds! Embrace my volatile creations and make these fools tremble at the mere sight of your power!
They called me a tyrant for upholding order - for daring to keep the Frog scum in their place. They banished me, left me to rot, and called it justice? Hypocrites, all of them!
Fate has a cruel sense of humor - one day you're swinging the axe, the next you're kneeling at the executioner's block.
Those filthy little thieves are heartless! We were starving, and they just watched and laughed in our faces. It has to stop. Teach them a lesson.

We cherished the Flame - it enveloped us with its warmth. But suddenly... It went out. I can't remember what happened. Please - you cant let this happen again! Let the sound of axes echo through the forest.
Nothing matters except the Queen. It is an honor to serve her. Show how loyal you are. Otherwise, I will have to punish you.
A mysterious chest filled with treasure. It was left behind by a restless spirit as a token of appreciation.

A group of fallen Bat miners, their tools left where they dropped. It seems they were scouting for a new mining site when something struck them down. The sight of these bodies causes unrest among the Bat population.
A group of fallen Beaver traders. They were probably assaulted by Fishmen. Or worse... The sight causes anxiety amongst the Beaver population.

A patron of the spirit world. Once discovered, it flees to a nearby Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">). It is said that a special treasure awaits the one who captures it.

Its elusive nature allows it to move like a ghost through the foggy thicket. It is believed that the beast is tied to the spirit world and the Ancestors. A special treasure awaits the one who finds it.

A deadly carrion organism that feeds on decaying matter. It spreads through contaminated rainwater and multiplies with time, becoming more and more dangerous. Blood Flowers are a source of extremely rare resources.
A Rainpunk Cauldron filled with a Blightrot-contaminated liquid. A moving, living fluid spreads around.
A long time ago, I founded a prosperous settlement. Everything was fine, until one of our scouts discovered something terrifying in the forest. Please, help restore at least a scrap of my legacy.
Many viceroys disregard nature. Don't make the same mistake. Be a good example to your people.
In these difficult times, beauty helps us forget our troubles. Decorate your village, and your villagers will thank you.

I promised my Queen that I would cleanse this forest of all the horrors that lived here. One night, my mount got frightened by the storm, and we fell into the Fishmen's nets. My mission must be completed!
Spread the word about the power of the Holy Fire! Only it can save us from the storm's wrath. Gather the villagers in the chapel and pray!
If your eyes sparkle at the sight of gold, I have an offer for you. All you have to do is prove that you are one of us, and I will give you my treasure.
The foundation of success is a thriving settlement. Without solid walls, you won't survive here. Create something you can be proud of.
The last thing I remember is lightning hitting my caravan. The settlements are still waiting for the goods they ordered. If you deliver them, Ill see that youre rewarded.
Let the fire burn in the Hearth and grow in all its strength. Sacrifice your goods, and help the villagers weather the storm!
Our flock has been in mourning for many years. We will never forget the war. Please, rekindle the hope in the Harpies' hearts.
I lived in a very prosperous settlement, but our viceroy was greedy and didn't care about the forest at all! In the end, it brought doom upon us. Refrain from greed, and calm the forest.
My army fought bravely against all odds. Many of us paid the ultimate price. Please, show your respect to those who survived. I'll take care of the fallen.
I've lived a long and prosperous life, and I've never let a business opportunity pass me by. Good deals have a nasty habit of vanishing very quickly, so seize them!
The everlasting rain is a as much a gift as it is a curse. And yet it made us stronger, more resilient. Embrace it.
I was a Teadoctor for years, helping my kind endure the effects of our strange illness. In the end, the disease took me. Take care of my people for me, please.
These hands once built sturdy homes from raw stone; now I call upon you to restore and improve them so that they may stand the test of time.
In life I was a philosopher and a teacher. Now, in death, I long for those days. So let me teach you - lift the spirits of your people. Nourish their minds and bodies.
In life I wandered without aim; in death I beg you to spare others the same fate. Build a sanctuary for those who have no roof over their heads.
The air turned to poison, and the dark took us all Please, stranger - don't let this happen again.
I've had enough of all these uptight do-gooders, with their pristine morals and boring attitudes. It's time to start some trouble!
I wish Id stayed with my loved ones in the Citadel. Now, all I'm left with is regret. Don't follow in my footsteps. Be kind to those around you.
A mysterious chest filled with treasure. It was left behind by a restless spirit as a token of appreciation.
A destroyed camp in the wilderness. There are still survivors in the area.
A destroyed camp in the wilderness. There are still survivors in the area.
A destroyed caravan was found in the newly discovered glade. There are drag marks leading deeper into the forest... What could have caused such mayhem?
A destroyed caravan, stranded in the wilderness. There are drag marks leading deeper into the forest... What could have caused such mayhem?

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Corrupted Caravan T2 - Send

description: A large caravan abandoned in the woods, overgrown with Blightrot Cysts. They must have fed on the transported goods... or people.
A sinister stone structure created to worship the Blightrot. Cultists have engraved the inscription: "Nothing escapes death".

Dangerous convicts from the Smoldering City are hiding in the forest. They somehow managed to free themselves during transport. You can decide their fate - welcome them and employ them in your settlement, or send them back to the Citadel where they will be punished.
It looks abandoned, but what if it's not? A terrible fishy smell comes from within.
Once upon a time, there must have been a coast and a harbor here. Now this place is haunted by Fishmen and the waters have withdrawn. An ominous light is coming from the top of the lighthouse.
Fishmen aren't usually a threat, but they can be a real nuisance after a while.
An old wandering soothsayer, teeming with magic. He does not speak, though you can hear his voice. His eyes are blank, yet you can feel his gaze. He is not afraid of death, he stands by its side.
The Forsaken Crypt hides a frustrated, poor spirit. This place seems to have been plundered a long time ago.
A group of fallen Fox scouts. They must have been sent to search the area to make sure it was safe... Apparently, something stood in their way. This find is causing grief among the Fox population.
A group of fallen Frog architects. It seems they were in the middle of building some sort of monument. The mere sight of these bodies causes unrest among the Frog population.
Old Rainpunk machinery left unsupervised. Unstable rainwater fumes fill the area.
A truly rare sight - a Spectral Treasure Stag, lured to this place by the lingering anguish of mortal souls. Those who manage to find it will be rewarded with a special treasure.
A never-before encountered Stormbird subspecies. She is fiercely guarding her nest. The clouds around the settlement have begun to darken...
The Hermit rarely visits royal settlements, and actively avoids the Crown's officials. But he seems eager to trade with you.
A strange woman is observing the settlement from afar.
A mysterious and imposing figure has been spotted near the settlement. He is pulling a wagon full of herbs and ointments.

A patron of the spirit world. Once discovered, it flees to a nearby Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">). It is said that a special treasure awaits the one who captures it.

Its elusive nature allows it to move like a ghost through the foggy thicket. It is believed that the beast is tied to the spirit world and the Ancestors. A special treasure awaits the one who finds it.
An old altar found in the wilds. The ancient language carved into the stone proclaims: "Light a fire at the altar to gain the blessing of the Spirit of Harmony".
A group of fallen Harpy scientists... The sight causes unrest amongst the Harpy population.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Haunted Ruined Bat House - Rebuild

description: This building is haunted by evil spirits. They are protecting it because it's one of a kind. It can be rebuilt or destroyed.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Haunted Ruined Temple - Rebuild

description: This building is haunted by evil spirits. They are protecting it because it's one of a kind. It can be rebuilt or destroyed.
A group of fallen Human explorers. They were probably looking for a place to settle, far from the Queen's watchful eyes... The sight causes uneasiness amongst the Human population.

One of the mythical guardians of the forest - still alive, but plagued by a mysterious disease. The Blightrot has taken over his mind, causing an unstoppable rage. You can try to heal him... or whisper prayers to its new masters.
The once mighty tree has been deformed by the Blightrot living in its root system. The Blightrot poisons the tree's tissues, leading to its long-lasting degradation.
A legendary, shape-shifting aquatic spirit that lurks near water and mesmerizes travelers. It is said that whoever acquires the kelpie's bridle will be able to control it.
An old, broken piece of Rainpunk technology. It's contaminating the soil around it.
A weird contraption that attracts lightning. Its proximity to the settlement might have grave consequences.
A group of fallen Lizard hunters... The sight causes unrest amongst the Lizard population.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ship Wreck - Upper deck

effects.effectId: Pack of Trade Goods Worth More

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ship Wreck - Lower deck

description: How powerful must the storm surge have been to carry this shattered wreck all the way here? Perhaps in the distant past, there was a sea here? It looks as if its been lying here for centuries. Strange voices can be heard coming from below deck...
A small, yet dangerous creature. It normally lives underground or hides in the mist, but this one seems to be more courageous than its kin.
A wild beast that usually lives underground. It was forced to the surface for some reason.
A mystical stone monument. Unknown runes are carved all over its surface.
A damaged and abandoned rainpunk contraption. The area was probably deserted because of a significant explosion risk. The machine's valves emit a distinct Blightrot odor.
A strange tree thats been turned to stone by the rain. It's radiating its sickness to the other trees around it.
A totem built by the Fishmen. It seems to have affected the weather, making the rain heavier.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Rainpunk Drill - Fix - Coal

description: An old, abandoned piece of advanced Rainpunk technology. It seems extremely unstable - but maybe it can be rebuilt...
An abandoned cache of goods. This could be a lost shipment - or something much more valuable.
An abandoned cache of goods. This could be a lost shipment - or something much more valuable.
An abandoned cache of goods. This could be a lost shipment - or something much more valuable.
A building destroyed by the storm. It can be rebuilt or salvaged.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ruined Crude Workstation - Salvage

description: A building destroyed by the storm. It can be rebuilt or salvaged.
A religious structure built by the Fishmen. It interferes with the Hearth in the center of the settlement.

Royal archaeologists are certain that a phenomenal discovery is hidden here. The Queen offers a generous reward for unearthing this ancient skeleton. This event is multi-stage and includes excavation, conservation, and reconstruction of the skeleton.
After successfully excavating most of the ancient bones, they now need to be carefully conserved before proceeding to the reconstruction stage. However, the creature has not yet been identified.

Archaeologists are ready to begin the final stage - reconstruction. A mythical creature is finally being unearthed. Huge bones are put together, revealing the full form of the monster that once inhabited this land.
An open entrance to an ancient dungeon. Strange sounds can be heard coming from inside.

Royal archaeologists are certain that a phenomenal discovery is hidden here. The Queen offers a generous reward for unearthing this ancient skeleton. This event is multi-stage and includes excavation, conservation, and reconstruction of the skeleton.
After successfully excavating most of the ancient bones, they now need to be carefully conserved before proceeding to the reconstruction stage. However, the creature has not yet been identified.

Archaeologists are ready to begin the final stage - reconstruction. A mythical creature is finally being unearthed. Huge bones are put together, revealing the full form of the monster that once inhabited this land.

Royal archaeologists are certain that a phenomenal discovery is hidden here. The Queen offers a generous reward for unearthing this ancient skeleton. This event is multi-stage and includes excavation, conservation, and reconstruction of the skeleton.
After successfully excavating most of the ancient bones, they now need to be carefully conserved before proceeding to the reconstruction stage. However, the creature has not yet been identified.

Archaeologists are ready to begin the final stage - reconstruction. A mythical creature is finally being unearthed. Huge bones are put together, revealing the full form of the monster that once inhabited this land.
An aggressive, parasitic species, able to eat and digest even the hardest materials.
An ominous shrine from a long forgotten era. It's dangerous, but it might hold some ancient knowledge useful to the crown.

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Keep
Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Report

description: A cemetery full of traders killed by desperate viceroys. What drove them to commit such heinous crimes? Was it out of greed, or necessity?

decisionsRewards.tableId: Loot Table - Ancient Relics Forbidden - Report

description: A destroyed royal guard camp. It looks as if one of their warbeasts got out and razed the entire encampment to the ground. The beast, usually obedient to its masters, must have been provoked by something.

A patron of the spirit world. Once discovered, it flees to a nearby Dangerous (<sprite name="dangerous">) or Forbidden Glade (<sprite name="forbidden">). It is said that a special treasure awaits the one who captures it.

Its elusive nature allows it to move like a ghost through the foggy thicket. It is believed that the beast is tied to the spirit world and the Ancestors. A special treasure awaits the one who finds it.
A wildfire spirit. It will wreak havoc on the settlement if it's not contained.
